headline.main: LEHIGH SURVIVORS BACK SHIP ARMING; 'It Will Be Better for Us and Not So Good for Jerry,' Say Some Landed at Bathurst

lead_paragraph: BATHURST, Gambia, Oct. 24 (U.P.) -- The remaining twenty-two survivors of the United States freighter Lehigh, torpedoed Sunday seventy-five miles off Freetown, have been landed here and some said today that "when we have guns it will be better for us and not so good for Jerry."
abstract: 22 survivors arrive, Bathurst, Gambia; comment on sinking and rescue
